Use the position of the sun to keep track of time: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west, and the position of the sun can be used to estimate the time of day. You can use the sun's position to determine the time of sunrise and sunset, and use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the phases of the moon to keep track of time: The moon goes through different phases over the course of a month, and these phases can be used to estimate the time of day. You can use the phase of the moon to determine the time of sunrise and sunset, and use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the movement of the stars to keep track of time: The stars move across the sky over the course of the night, and the position of the stars can be used to estimate the time of day. You can use the position of the stars to determine the time of sunrise and sunset, and use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the movement of the planets to keep track of time: The planets move across the sky over the course of the year, and the position of the planets can be used to estimate the time of day. You can use the position of the planets to determine the time of sunrise and sunset, and use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the movement of the tides to keep track of time: The tides rise and fall over the course of the day, and the height of the tides can be used to estimate the time of day. You can use the height of the tides to determine the time of sunrise and sunset, and use this information to estimate the time of day.
